english_translation: Narrated by a man from Bani Amir: I hoped to meet Abu Dharr. I saw him standing praying in the mosque beside a pillar. I recognized him by description, and he was wearing Qitriyah garment. I greeted him but he did not return the greeting. When he finished prayer and greeted, he returned. I said: Are you Abu Dharr? He said: My people claim that. I said: I hoped to meet you. He said: You have met me. I said: I am a man who is away from water and with me is my family. He said: Do you know Abu Dharr? I became discontented with Madinah so the Messenger of Allah ﷺ ordered me with camels and ordered me to drink from their urine and milk. Hammad said: Then Ayyub used to say milk and would not mention urine. So I came to the Messenger of Allah ﷺ and he was sitting among the pillars of the mosque. He said: O Abu Dharr. I said: I am in a state of major ritual impurity, O Messenger of Allah. So he called for water and a black slave girl came with it in a container that sloshed. The Messenger of Allah ﷺ ordered a man from his companions to screen me, so I screened myself with the camel and washed. Then I came to him. He said: O Abu Dharr, the earth is sufficient for you even for ten pilgrimages. When you find water then let it touch your skin or your skin.

english_translation:
Chain 1: Narrated by a man from the people of Ash-Sham from his father: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: Submit. He said: And what is Islam? He said: Your heart becomes submissive to Allah, Mighty and Majestic, and the Muslims become safe from your tongue and your hand. He said: Which Islam is best? He said: Faith. He said: And what is faith? He said: You believe in Allah, Mighty and Majestic, and His angels, and His books, and in the resurrection after death. He said: Which faith is best? He said: Emigration. He said: And what is emigration? He said: That you abandon evil. He said: Which emigration is best? He said: Jihad. He said: And what is jihad? He said: That you fight the disbelievers when you encounter them. Then two deeds are from the best of deeds except for one who does the like of them, saying it three times: A pilgrimage that is accepted or an Umrah.

A man from his people attacked him and swore not to live with him in any land. So he went to Ash-Sham and was there. One day he was sitting with some of the companions of the Prophet ﷺ. He said: Who will tell me a hadith which he heard from the Messenger of Allah ﷺ? A man from Bani Sulaim, called Amr ibn Abas, said: May Allah bless your father and be cautious. I heard the Messenger of Allah ﷺ say: Whoever throws an arrow in the way of Allah, it is like the value of a freed slave. May Allah bless your father and be cautious.

english_translation: He said: A hadith I would not have neglected to narrate if I had only heard it once or twice or thrice or four times or five times. I heard the Messenger of Allah ﷺ say: There is no Muslim who calls for ablution and washes his face except that his sins fall away from his face from the edges of his beard. If he washes his hand, his sins fall away from his hand from between his nails and fingertips. If he wipes his head, his sins fall away from his head from the edges of his hair. If he washes his feet, his sins fall away from his feet from the soles of his feet. If he prays in congregation, his reward falls upon Allah. If he prays two units of prayer with sincerity of heart to Allah, Mighty and Majestic, they are his atonement. Ayyub said: I said to Abu Qilabah: Two units? He said: Do you not see that he says: Then he makes sincere in them his heart to Allah, Mighty and Majestic?

english_translation: Narrated by a descendant: Someone from our family died while not on Islam, so his daughter inherited him to the exclusion of myself and she was upon his religion. Then my grandfather accepted Islam and witnessed with the Messenger of Allah ﷺ at Hunayn. He died and left date palms. She accepted Islam. Then she disputed over the inheritance with Uthman ibn Affan. Abdullah ibn al-Arqam narrated that Umar ibn al-Khattab ruled that whoever accepts Islam upon an inheritance before it is divided, for him is his share. So Uthman ruled for her. She took the first portion and shared with me in the other.

english_translation: This is what Abu Hurairah narrated to us from Muhammad the Messenger of Allah ﷺ. He said: We are the last but the first on the Day of Judgment, except that they were given the Scripture before us and they differed about it. We were given it after them. This is their day which was prescribed for them so they differed about it, but Allah guided us to it. So they follow us in it. The Jews will come tomorrow and the Christians will come the day after tomorrow. My example and the example of the prophets before me is like the example of a man who built houses and made them beautiful and complete, except for one brick from one corner. People would admire the building and say: If only this brick had been placed! So I am that brick.
